repnme.cdata!:
Africa - Central African Backbone Program
            Project : APL1B

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Central African Backbone
            (CAB) Program Project for Africa were as follows: outcomes
            were not applicable, risk to development outcome was not
            applicable, Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. The
            transaction adviser conducted a legal analysis, which showed
            that key features of the Societe d'Infrastructures de
            Transmission des Communications electroniques par fibre
            optique du Tchad (SITCOM) transaction were clearly
            contradictory to the agreements made over the prior two
            years between Chad, Central African Republic (CAR), and the
            Communaute Economique et Monetaire des Etats d'Afrique
            Centrale (CEMAC) commission and reflected in the signed
            Financial Agreements (FAs) and Memorandum of Understanding
            (MOU). In essence, the SITCOM transaction will have
            jeopardized the integrity of the CAB concept of a seamless
            regional network, specifically in terms of elements such as
            interconnection, security, pricing, and quality of service.
            The SITCOM transaction was incompatible with the project
            design and the financing agreement. The existing situation
            made it impossible to meet the effectiveness condition
            related to the international CAB network and was contrary to
            the MOU already signed. The team was convinced that: (i)
            Chad will not be able to meet the effectiveness deadline for
            the FA, which was initially set for October 10, 2012; and
            (ii) will probably request an extension of the effectiveness date.

repnme.cdata!: Africa - Central African Backbone - APL1B Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the First Phase of the
            Central African Backbone - Adaptable Program Loan (APL) 1B
            Project is to contribute to increase geographical reach and
            usage of regional broadband network services and reduce
            their prices, in the Republic of Chad and the Central
            African Republic. There are two components to the project,
            the first component being connectivity. This component will
            finance a public private partnership structure to support
            the deployment of interconnected networks to form a regional
            network, and additional technical assistance or support for
            an effective management and monitoring of Central African
            Backbone (CAB) networks. Finally, the second component is
            the project management. This component will finance
            management related issues at the project level. This
            component will help to strengthen the existing project
            implementation unit (PIU) established at national level.

repnme.cdata!:
Africa - Central African Backbone Project :
            Environmental Assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The main aim of the draft
            Telecommunications Network fiber optic broadband or Central
            African Backbone (CAB) is to contribute to increased
            effective connectivity at the regional level and as specific
            objectives will contribute (i) to the development of growth
            shared by: accelerating the deployment of fiber networks by
            investing in infrastructure; removing monopoly regimes and
            exclusively by the establishment of a legal and regulatory
            framework ensuring the access to all operators in the
            infrastructure transparent conditions, (ii) to reduce
            business costs, (iii) to the ability of the state to
            implement Electronic Government (eGovernment). Environmental
            impacts and social impacts of the project will come mainly
            from the laying of fiber which search and traverse human
            settlements, fields, forests, etc. that may lead to the soil
            erosion, soil pollution and the water and vegetation loss,
            disruption of life, inconvenience of traffic, noise, dust,
            the risk of accident and the generation of solid and liquid
            waste, the occupation of private lands, and the destruction
            of crops.

display_title.display_title:
Africa - Central African Backbone
            Project : Environmental Assessment : Environmental Social
            Management Plan

14212249.subsc: General industry and trade sector,Telecommunications,General information and communications sector

repnme.cdata!:
Africa - Central African Backbone Project :
            Resettlement Policy Framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Central
            African Backbone (CAB) Telecommunications project is to
            contribute to the effective increase of regional
            connectivity and as specific objectives will contribute (i)
            to the development of growth shared by: accelerating the
            deployment of fiber optic networks through investment in
            infrastructure; eliminating monopolistic schemes and
            exclusively by the establishment of a legal and regulatory
            framework to ensure the access for all operators to
            infrastructure in transparent conditions; (ii) to reduce the
            cost of doing business; (iii) the ability of the state to
            implement the electronic government (e-government).The
            purpose of the Resettlement Policy Framework is to identify
            frameworks and conditions to: (i) avoid or minimize
            involuntary resettlement where it is feasible, exploring all
            viable alternative project designs; (ii) help displaced
            persons improve their former living standards, their ability
            to generate income or at least restore their people; (iii)
            encourage community production in the planning and
            implementation of resettlement; and (iv) provide the
            assistance to affected people regardless of the legality or
            tenure. The CAB project is likely to cause the following
            potential impacts: (i) Impact on land: Permanent Acquisition
            of land required by the facility; (ii) Impact on buildings
            and other structures: Loss of habitats or buildings, limited
            following the completion of socio-economic infrastructure
            base operations; (iii) Impact on livelihood and income.
